Master 2 M2 Apprentissage et Traitement Automatique de la Langue (ATAL)
Année universitaire||||master Informatique||
Research methodology||Master|3|M2 Apprentissage et Traitement Automatique de la Langue (ATAL)
column2: M2 Visual Computing (VICO)||The first block of the Research Methodology teaching unit is dedicated to understanding what scientific knowledge production means
column3: how scientific knowledge develops with scientific publishing
column4: what scientific disciplines are and to discuss the relations between science and society. Then we focus on the content of scientific documents
column6: and how to write scientific material
column7: before addressing the topic of how to search for scientific material with the tools at hand and organize them in a bibliography.

column1: Experimental methodology and statistics|Experimental methodology and statistics|Master|3|M2 Data Science (DS)
column3: M2 Apprentissage et Traitement Automatique de la Langue (ATAL)||The third block of the Research Methodology teaching unit offers a comprehensive exploration of experimental methodologies
column4: starting with the hypothetico-deductive method and extending to exploratory science and data collection aimed at modeling and prediction. Students will gain an understanding of both qualitative and quantitative variables
column5: as well as dependent variables (VD) and factors influencing experiments. The curriculum delves into experimental design plans
column6: covering both between-subjects and within-subjects designs. Additionally
column7: the course provides a solid foundation in descriptive statistics
column8: including the examination of various distributions such as Poisson and Bernoulli. To equip students with the tools for rigorous data analysis
column9: the course also covers inferential statistics tailored for experimental data.

Gestion des données distribuées à large échelle|Gestion des données distribuées à large échelle|Master|3|M2 Architectures Logicielles (ALMA)
column2: M2 Apprentissage et Traitement Automatique de la Langue (ATAL)|"• To understand how big are big data and how distributed infrastructures are able to handle them

column1: • To understand why traditional databases cannot handle big data
• To know online transaction processing
column2: online analytical processing and streaming processing on big data.

column1: • To know representative distributed datastore for big data OLTP ie. CouchBase
• To know how to program with Map-Reduce
• To know consistent hashing
• To know multi-version concurrency control and consistency issues in large scale datastore
• To be able to understand how current datastore are built
column2: what they can do and what are their limitations.

column1: • To be able to use large scale datastore for OLTP
